pain_points.description: The website looks outdated and unappealing.
supporting_quotes: it’s a very tired looking site
pain_points.frequency_severity: Frequently mentioned as a major issue; described with negative emotional intensity.
pain_points.current_workarounds: None mentioned; user has to tolerate the outdated design.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Decreases user engagement and overall satisfaction with the website.

pain_points.description: Difficulty in finding specific information and events on the website.
supporting_quotes: I find difficulty in accessing on the website
What I'm often looking for is a particular event to register for
I'm often looking for what events am I registered to
pain_points.frequency_severity: Frequently mentioned as a source of frustration; emotionally charged.
pain_points.current_workarounds: User may resort to searching multiple times or contacting others for help.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Causes frustration and may prevent user from participating in events.

pain_points.description: Lack of community resources and basic information on the website.
supporting_quotes: wouldn't it be great if we could just have an area that's questions from people moving to Santa Barbara
basic information, where to register to vote, where to pay your taxes
pain_points.frequency_severity: Mentioned as a significant opportunity for improvement; user expresses desire for this feature.
pain_points.current_workarounds: User likely relies on external resources or local knowledge.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Limits the support and information available for newcomers, impacting their integration into the community.

pain_points.description: Need for better self-service options for customer support.
supporting_quotes: I’d like to have it be more self-service when it comes to customer support
too often, it's the simplest issues that get people hung up
pain_points.frequency_severity: Highlighted as an important need; user feels strongly about this.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may have to reach out for help or rely on others for support.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Increases frustration and dissatisfaction, especially among admins and board members.

pain_points.description: The calendar app is difficult to use for finding events.
supporting_quotes: to improve the calendar app, just to make it much easier to find events
pain_points.frequency_severity: Mentioned as a priority for improvement; user is clearly frustrated.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may resort to checking events through other means or struggling with the existing app.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Hinders event participation and user experience.

pain_points.description: Lack of support options for new users.
supporting_quotes: kind of provide more of a route for new users to make it easy for them to do what they want to do
pain_points.frequency_severity: Noted as a potential improvement; user acknowledges this as a gap.
pain_points.current_workarounds: New users may have to seek help from existing members or struggle on their own.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Creates a barrier for new users, potentially discouraging them from engaging with the community.
